full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 102 of 262 1807
LC8VMAX4 Rodgers - direct
1 A. Larry Visoski.
2 Q. What was his job?
3 A. Larry was a co-captain and director of maintenance.
4 Q. And for how long did Larry work with you for Mr. Epstein?
5 A. For Mr. Epstein we were 28 years with Mr. Epstein alive, a little longer after that.
6 
7 MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, would you please pull up what's in evidence as Government Exhibit 112.
8 
9 Q. Mr. Rodgers, do you recognize the person in that photograph?
10 
11 A. Yes, that's Jeffrey Epstein.
12 
13 MS. COMEY: We can take that down.
14 Thank you, Ms. Drescher.
15 Q. About how old was Jeffrey Epstein when he hired you in 1991?
16 
17 A. Thirty-eight.
18 Q. What were your responsibilities as chief pilot for your first 13 years of employment with Mr. Epstein?
19 
20 A. As chief pilot, there are a lot of responsibilities. But probably the one that would be at the top would be safety, making sure that the airplane is always operated in a safe manner; making sure that you're following FAA regulations and rules; making sure that your pilots are retrained every year, recurrent training. And also, more importantly is following maintenance procedures for the aircraft to make sure it stays
21 
22 
23 
24 
25 
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300
DOJ-OGR-00018964

text_blocks.content:
1 A. Larry Visoski.
2 Q. What was his job?
3 A. Larry was a co-captain and director of maintenance.
4 Q. And for how long did Larry work with you for Mr. Epstein?
5 A. For Mr. Epstein we were 28 years with Mr. Epstein alive, a little longer after that.
6 
7 MS. COMEY: Ms. Drescher, would you please pull up what's in evidence as Government Exhibit 112.
8 
9 Q. Mr. Rodgers, do you recognize the person in that photograph?
10 
11 A. Yes, that's Jeffrey Epstein.
12 
13 MS. COMEY: We can take that down.
14 Thank you, Ms. Drescher.
15 Q. About how old was Jeffrey Epstein when he hired you in 1991?
16 
17 A. Thirty-eight.
18 Q. What were your responsibilities as chief pilot for your first 13 years of employment with Mr. Epstein?
19 
20 A. As chief pilot, there are a lot of responsibilities. But probably the one that would be at the top would be safety, making sure that the airplane is always operated in a safe manner; making sure that you're following FAA regulations and rules; making sure that your pilots are retrained every year, recurrent training. And also, more importantly is following maintenance procedures for the aircraft to make sure it stays
